title: Describing the Sampling Distribution of a Proportion
question_text: You take a sample of size $35$ from a very large population in which the true proportion of males is $p = 0.52$. Which of the statements below best describes what is known about the sampling distribution of $\hat{p}$, the sample proportion of males?

choices.text:
$\mu_{\hat{p}} = 0.52$
$\sigma_{\hat{p}} = \sqrt{\dfrac {(0.52)(0.48)} {35}}$
The distribution is not approximately Normal.

$\mu_{\hat{p}} = 0.52$
The formula for $\sigma_{\hat{p}}$ will not give an accurate value as the $10$% condition is violated.
The distribution is approximately Normal.

$\mu_{\hat{p}} = 0.52$
The formula for $\sigma_{\hat{p}}$ will not give an accurate value as the $10$% condition is violated.
The distribution is not approximately Normal.

We cannot calculate the value of $\mu_{\hat{p}}$.
$\sigma_{\hat{p}} = \sqrt{\dfrac {(0.52)(0.48)} {35}}$
The distribution is approximately Normal.
